net.allwebdesign.common.lib.utils
Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  net.allwebdesign.common.lib.utils.Utils

public class Utils
extends Object

A class which serves as a toolkit of useful methods
It includes the following:
- normalize: sorts and converts a Map to Map

Author:
George Moraitakis

Method Detail

normalize

public static Map<String,Object> normalize(Map<String,Object[]> map)
Sorts alphabetically a Map based on the keys and at the same time it converts it to a Map. Useful when passing a map of this type e.g. an HttpRequest parameter map. It will then concatenate the array of values to a single comma separated value.

Parameters:
map - the Map from e.g. HttpRequest.getParameterMap()
Returns:
a comma separated value in a Map

word,pdf,powerpoint,excel,zip,png,gif,jpg,tif

prependZeroes

public static String prependZeroes(int num)
Prepends zeroes to an integer to make it a string with 30 digits

Parameters:
num - the integer to prepend zeroes to
Returns:
a 30 digit String integer prepended with zeroes

mapDelimitedValues

public static Map<String,String> mapDelimitedValues(String values,
                                                    String delim,
                                                    String... keys)
                                             throws Exception
Maps a raw string of values separated by a delimiter to a list of keys.

Parameters:
values - the raw string of values separated by a delimiter
delim - the delimiter
keys - the keys to map the values to
Returns:
the mapped values
Throws:
Exception - if the values do not match the number of keys

addDelimitedValuesToMap

public static Map<String,String> addDelimitedValuesToMap(String values,
                                                         String regExDelim,
                                                         Map map,
                                                         String... keys)
                                                  throws Exception
Adds to a map a raw string of values separated by a delimiter

Parameters:
values - the raw string of values separated by a delimiter
regExDelim - the delimiter which is a regular expression (e.g. for pipe delimited use \\| )
map - the map to add the values to
keys - the keys to map the values to
Returns:
the mapped values
Throws:
Exception - if the values do not match the number of keys
